data.name: Inledning
entries: Ända sedan jag kom med i D&D-teamet 2010 har jag funderat på en framtid där grungerna är "en grej" igen. Dessa sedan länge bortglömda amfibier från 2nd Edition Greyhawk-miljön hade fångat mitt hjärta och min fantasi för länge sedan. Så det var med en viss grad av grung som jag lade in dem i kampen om varelser som skulle väljas ut som en del av Volos Guide to Monsters. De var verkligen inte det favoritvalet, men i slutändan när vi var och en fick en "gyllene biljett" att ge till en varelse. Trots hån från mina arbetskamrater stod det klart för mig vilket mitt val skulle bli. Grung för livet!!!

Sedan dess har jag fått möjlighet att omformulera dem, skriva om dem och inkludera dem bland de varelser som potentiellt kan existera i vilken D&D-kampanj som helst... och så hände det. Någon frågade mig om jag ville vara DM för ett bord med spelare under Stream of Annihilation. Med den ALL-STAR cast av kändisar som skulle delta, plus superstjärniga DMs som Chris Perkins och Mike Mearls som skulle följa, var jag tvungen att hitta något som skulle skilja mig från resten... eller åtminstone bekräfta för världen att jag bara är en excentrisk knäppskalle... vilket som helst lät bra för mig. Vid denna tidpunkt tänkte jag högt... "Tänk om alla mina spelare var grung?" Resten är historia... och framtid. Du kan till och med se den på YouTube.

Jag vill tacka dessa personer... alla fantastiska DMs också, som gav liv åt grung i Stream of Annihilation-spelet. Matt Colville som b'Loop; Mark Hulmes som b'Lip; Adam Koebel som b'Lahp; och Nadja Otikor som c'Ahbülos... Och jag vill tacka dem som fortsätter att "Grung it up!" på Twitch tillsammans med mig... Satine Phoenix som d'Ahten'khan; Ruty Rutenberg som b'Leep; Lauren Urban som b'Ang'r'Ang; och ett särskilt välkommen till min nya spelare... Cig Neutron som den albino dvärgmunken Mee'Yah-Ghee.
Ni har alla gjort mig till ett mycket lyckligt DM!

entries.name: 5th-level Grung Monk Courtier
entries: As an orange grung, d'Ahten'khan is the highest caste member of the group, and its strategic leader. Not the most studied grung, d'Ahten'khan relied heavily on c'Ahbülos for relevant information and lore, prior to the red grung's untimely demise at the hands of the batiri.

d'Ahten'khan now relies on b'Ang'r'Ang, whom she trusts implicitly with communicating her commands to b'Leep, a green grung scout, and last remaining member of her squad. As b'Leep is well beneath her station d'Ahten'khan will not ever communicate directly with this lower caste grung.
As the leader of a previously successful band of grung, d'Ahten'khan developed aspirations of nobility, and finds it difficult to not overly communicate these to any worthy grung who will listen.

entries.name: 5th-level Grung Rogue Outlander
entries: As a higher caste hunter and purple grung, b'Ang'r'Ang is the tactical, courageous leader and devoted mentor of b'Lip, b'Loop, b'Leep, and b'Lahp. The most conscientious of the group, she bears the burden of responsibility for her green cousins, which previously led to conflict with b'Lip, who prefers to act before thinking.

Recognizing her place in the grung hierarchy, b'Ang'r'Ang is responsible for working with the brothers to execute on "plans" developed by d'Ahten'khan, who relies upon b'Ang'r'Ang to communicate instructions to the much-lower caste green grung. After a recent batiri goblin ambush where the band of grung scattered to the four winds, the whereabouts of b'Lip, b'Loop, and b'Lahp remain unknown.

entries.name: 5th-level Grung Rogue Outlander
entries: One of four nearly identical green grung, b'Leep was raised from an egg alongside his siblings. The grung were trained from hatchlings to be the ultimate band of hunters.

Quiet and methodical, b'Leep experiences a greater than average level of anxiety... EVERYWHERE. Constantly on the lookout for the tricks and traps of others, b'Leep has an almost intuitive sense for dealing with strange locks and mechanisms, and is quite knowledgeable about the jungle and its dangers. He is extremely loyal to his siblings and b'Ang'r'Ang.

entries.name: 6th-level Albino Dwarf Monk Hermit
entries: A devoted member of the Ytepka Society, Mee'YahGhee spends most of his time occupying various taverns in the Merchant's Ward of Port Nyanzaru, drinking, and generally keeping tabs on goings on in the city in that regard. All manner of folks are willing to talk freely around a drunk albino dwarf that can barely seem to recall his own name.

Years ago, during his hermitage, Mee'Yah-Ghee trained the young grung d'Ahtenkhan. As he's heard of the shake up in the hierarchy within her army, Mee'Yah-Ghee has ventured into the jungle to find his student and help her in any way he can.

entries.name: Whistle-Stick
entries: The grung of ONE GRUNG ABOVE are trained to use this new musical instrument. This is a hollow tube with holes cut throughout, much like a flute. You can play music with it for entertainment, but the grung also swing it about by a sturdy cord (attached) to create a sound recognizable by other grung, so they know each other's approximate location. Additionally, grung that know Thieves' Cant can use a whistle stick in this manner to communicate over distance.

entries.name: Grung Traits
entries: Your {@race grung|OGA} character has an assortment of inborn abilities, part and parcel of grung nature.
